Hugh Harman and Mel Shaw, two veteran animators, quit their jobs at MGM and Disney to start an independent company; one of their first projects was to be a King Arthur cartoon.The animators never got beyond preparing storyboards before America entered World War II, and afterward they were never able to restart the project. I am grateful to Michael Salda not only for his research on the subject of Arthurian animation, which has opened up a new area of study in Arthurian popular culture to me and many others, but also for sharing copies of a number of the cartoons discussed in this essay
